<support> JSON can be natively understood by JavaScript parsers, including node.js


JSON libraries

Java: JSR 353 (JSONP), FasterXML Jackson, Google Gson, JSON-Java, or jsoniter
JavaScript: json2.js (only needed in old browsers without native JSON support)

<lose> <disadvantage> Note that registration of serializers and adapters use the exact same code:

If you find that you need to stick with an adapter, then you can use an embedded Gson proxy to serialize the Pair properties for you, with the disadvantage that you lose access to custom registrations that you made on the parent Gson proxy:
